page.title: 11BIRD SURVEY-Part one
page.content: Our survey area consists of four main bird habitats: 1.BIRKRIGG COMMON-area of open moorland,gorse and heather, with occasional hawthorn. 2.BARDSEA BEACH-shingle beach,backed by small trees and bushes.The tide retreats a long way leaving large areas of mud and sandflats which form the northern part of Morecambe Bay. 3.AGRICULTURAL LAND-flat farmland. Hedges and stone walls separate fields used mainly for grazing.Occasional small streams. 4.ESTATE-pleasant tree-lined roads. All houses with gardens. Includes the school field and the estate's play areas. The bird survey was carried out in September 1985. Please see page 12 for the results of our bird sightings.
